column5: well, i think that the electoral college, i mean, i understand the framers and our history and it's always good to respect history, but if you look at the electoral college, it's they're largely because our founding fathers did not trust the common man to vote properly. they wanted there to be a screen of the elite that made sure that we didn't get demagogue. so if now, most people are saying we trust the average american and that that's the way we want to go, then the electoral college no longer works.
column7:
1. The electoral college was created because the founding fathers did not trust the common man to vote properly.
2. The electoral college was meant to act as a screen of the elite to prevent the election of a demagogue.
3. If the majority of people now trust the average American to vote properly, then the electoral college is no longer necessary.
